xml.brief: Get information on current changelog and fulldump state

desc.p: [BETA] Get information on current changelog and fulldump state.

returns.p: A dictionary of the following structure:

li.p: changelog - a dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: min_revision - the lowest allowed value for the since attribute (the ID of the earliest changelog entry kept in our database),
max_revision - the current revision of the database (the ID of the newest changelog entry kept in our database),

li.p: latest_fulldump - a dictionary of the following structure:

ul.li: filename - name of the fulldump file (ex. "okapi-dump-r14054.tar.gz"),
revision - revision of the database saved in the latest fulldump,
generated_at - date and time (ISO 8601) when the fulldump was generated,
size - size of the file, in bytes,
size_uncompressed - approximate size of the uncompressed contents, in bytes.

returns.p: The response MAY contain changes recorded before the revision which you stated in your since parameter. This is due to caching. I we already have a response ready, that was produced for a "since" parameter which was a little more in the past, we may want to return this cached copy, instead of producing a new one. It will be faster for us, and you shouldn't even notice. We will still make sure to set the revision and more attributes in a correct way, which in turn will make you query us again, if you need to.
